results.name: a(n) = A276086(A108951(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2310
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
mathematica: With[{b = MixedRadix[Reverse@ Prime@ Range@ 120]}, Array[Function[k, Times @@ Power @@@ # &@ Transpose@ {Prime@ Range@ Length@ k, Reverse@ k}]@ IntegerDigits[Apply[Times, Map[#1^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> {Times @@ Prime@ Range@ PrimePi@ p, e}]], b] &, 58]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 18 2019 *)
program: A276086(n) = { my(i=0,m=1,pr=1,nextpr); while((n>0),i=i+1; nextpr = prime(i)*pr; if((n%nextpr),m*=(prime(i)^((n%nextpr)/pr));n-=(n%nextpr));pr=nextpr); m; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 30 2019
